title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to redesignate subsections and adjust the rate of payment for benefits. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to adjust the rate of payment for benefits by specifying exceptions and clarifying subsection references. Amendments to section 107 of title 38, United States Code, adjust benefit payment rates, specify exceptions, and clarify subsection references. The amendments made by subsection (b) will take effect on the date of enactment of this Act and apply to benefits paid for months beginning on or after that date. The amendment to section 107 of title 38, United States Code, regarding the rate of payment of dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans, will take effect on the date of enactment of this Act and apply to benefits paid for months beginning on or after that date. SEC. 4. ELIGIBILITY OF CERTAIN FILIPINO VETERANS FOR DISABILITY PENSION. Amendment to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, expands eligibility criteria for disability pension for certain Filipino veterans. Amendment to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code expands eligibility criteria for disability pension for certain Filipino veterans by amending subsection (b) to include chapters 11, 13 (except section 1312(a)), and 15 of the title. Additionally, a new subsection (e) is added regarding the rate of payment for benefits under chapter 15 paid to individuals residing in certain circumstances. A new subsection (e) is added regarding the rate of payment for benefits under chapter 15 of title 38, United States Code. If benefits are paid to an individual residing in the Republic of the Philippines, the rate of payment shall be $100 per month. The amendments made by this section will result in benefits being paid at a rate of $100 per month to individuals residing in the Republic of the Philippines, effective immediately upon enactment of the Act. SEC. 5 amends section 1734 of title 38, providing health care to Filipino veterans in the US. SEC. 6 addresses outpatient care for veterans in the Philippines. Section 1735 of title 38, United States Code, provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines, including treatment for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities. The Manila VA Outpatient Clinic provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans, Commonwealth Army veterans, and new Philippine Scouts in the Republic of the Philippines. The Secretary's expenditure for this purpose is limited to $500,000 per fiscal year, contingent on available appropriations. The Secretary's expenditure for outpatient care at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic in the Philippines is limited to $500,000 per fiscal year, subject to available appropriations. The amendments made by this section regarding outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines will take effect on the enactment date of this Act.
